value.title: Operational best practices for web apps on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure App Service hosts millions of apps, serves trillions of requests per day, and has an SLA of 99.95%. But what should you do when your app has issues in production? Byron Tardif joins Scott Hanselman to discuss some operational best practices for running your web apps on Azure App Service.  0:00
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JAqoLC2dv-M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Secure traffic between pods using network policies in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Did you know that by default, all pods in a Kubernetes cluster will accept traffic from any source? Now, with network policies available out-of-the-box in Azure Kubernetes Service you can isolate pods, control egress & ingress traffic, and secure your workloads. Saurya Das is here to show us how it works.

value.title: Serverless automation using PowerShell in Azure Functions | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Eamon O'Reilly joins Scott Hanselman to show how PowerShell in Azure Functions makes it possible for you to automate operational tasks and take advantage of the native Azure integration to deliver and maintain services. [01:150] Demo Start   Azure Functions overview https://aka.ms/azfr/540/01  Create

value.title: Serverless containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: In this episode, Azure CTO Mark Russinovich joins Scott Hanselman to show how you can use Azure Container Instances (ACI) to host a containerized application. Mark deploys an image processing container in three ways: as a standalone ACI container, as part of a Logic Apps workflow, and as the backend

value.excerpt: Azure Data Share is available in public preview today, and offers a simple pane of glass over your data sharing relationships. value.title: Unlock petabyte-scale datasets in Azure with aggregations in Power BI | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Christian Wade joins Scott Hanselman to show you how to unlock petabyte-scale datasets in Azure with a way that was not previously possible. Learn how to use the aggregations feature in Power BI to enable interactive analysis over big data.  For more information:  Power BI Desktop September 2018 Feature

value.title: Using Entity Framework Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jeremy Likness shows Scott Hanselman how to use Entity Framework (EF) Core with Azure SQL DB and Azure Cosmos DB. EF Core is a lightweight, extensible, open source, and cross-platform version of the popular Entity Framework data access technology.  0:00 – Overview 1:43 – Using Entity Framework Core with

value.title: What is Azure Sentinel and why you should care | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, you'll learn what Azure Sentinel is and how to use it. Azure Sentinel provides a threat detection and mitigation service that helps you to detect incident and threats when they happen and helps you to solve them as effectively as possible. value.excerpt: In the One Dev Question series, Cloud Developer Advocate Abel Wang explains how Azure DevOps provides developer services to support teams to plan work, collaborate on code development, and build and deploy applications. In this video, Abel explains the differences between VSTS and Azure DevOps.   Get

value.title: What to use for deploying and testing your applications in Azure | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Friends don't let friends right-click deploy. Azure provides many ways to deploy your application. In this episode, Azure Barry shows Scott Hanselman how to choose the right Azure service with which to deploy and test your app.  time  ◉ GitHub Actions – https://aka.ms/azfr/665/01 ◉ Azure DevOps – https://aka.ms/azfr/665/02

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.

value.title: Automate your deployments with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Learn how to combine automation techniques such as infrastructure as code with automated pipelines to provision and configure the infrastructure you need to run your applications and services.

topItems.title: Provision infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how infrastructure as code enables you to describe and automatically provision the infrastructure that you need for your application.

topItems.title: Configure infrastructure in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run configuration management tools in Azure Pipelines to help keep your infrastructure configured as you need.

topItems.title: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Provision databases in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Azure Database for PostgreSQL
value.excerpt: Azure Database for PostgreSQL

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: This module is a no-code introduction to PostgreSQL on Azure, including an explanation of particular problems that using Azure Database for PostgreSQL can solve. At a high level, we show how the components fit together and identify situations where you should use Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

topItems.title: Create and connect to an Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: Azure Database for PostgreSQL is a fully managed relational database solution. Learn how - and when - to use it. You’ll review different configurations and features, create and develop a database, and query it from an ASP.NET app.

topItems.title: Introduction to Hyperscale (Citus) on Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: When your database is small, it’s easy to throw more hardware at the problem and scale up. As these tables grow, you need to think about other ways to scale your database. Azure Database for PostgreSQL Hyperscale (Citus) transforms open-source PostgreSQL into a distributed database solution, reliably and securely managed on Azure.

value.title: Azure for the Data Engineer
value.excerpt: This learning path guides data engineers through the evolving benefits your organization gains with Azure cloud data platform technologies.

topItems.title: Understand the evolving world of data
topItems.excerpt: Discover how data systems and roles are evolving and explore the differences between on-premises and cloud data solutions using sample business cases.

topItems.title: Survey the services on the Azure Data platform
topItems.excerpt: Explore the broad array of Azure technologies that analyze text or images and relational, nonrelational, or streaming data.

topItems.title: Identify the tasks of a data engineer in a cloud-hosted architecture
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the responsibilities of a data engineer, how they relate to the jobs of other data and AI roles, and explore common data engineering practices.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 1: Describe core Azure concepts
value.excerpt: This learning path provides you with an introduction to the basics of Azure cloud computing and Azure architecture.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces you to the basics of Azure.

topItems.title: Discuss Azure fundamental concepts
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the different types and categories of cloud computing.

topItems.title: Describe core Azure architectural components
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure subscriptions, management groups, resource groups, Azure Resource Manager, Azure regions, and availability zones.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 4: Describe general security and network security features
value.excerpt: Learn about the various Azure services you can use to help ensure that your cloud resources are safe, secure, and trusted.

topItems.title: Protect against security threats on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you protect the workloads that you run both in the cloud and in your on-premises datacenter.

topItems.title: Secure network connectivity on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the Azure services you can use to help ensure that your network is safe, secure, and trusted.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 5: Describe identity, governance, privacy, and compliance features
value.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you secure access to cloud resources, what it means to build a cloud governance strategy, and how Azure adheres to common regulatory and compliance standards.

topItems.title: Secure access to your applications by using Azure identity services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Active Directory, single sign-on (SSO), multifactor authentication, and Conditional Access can help you manage and secure identities on Azure.

topItems.title: Build a cloud governance strategy on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to access policies, resource locks, and tags, as well as how Azure services such as Azure Policy and Azure Blueprints can help you build a comprehensive cloud governance strategy.

topItems.title: Examine privacy, compliance, and data protection standards on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft's commitment to privacy, how Azure adheres to common regulatory and compliance standards, and additional considerations government agencies need to make.

value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 6: Describe Azure cost management and service level agreements
value.excerpt: Learn about the factors that influence cost, tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend, and how Azure's service-level agreements (SLAs) can impact your application design decisions.

topItems.title: Plan and manage your Azure costs
topItems.excerpt: Migration to the cloud presents new ways to think about your IT expenses. This module teaches you about the factors that influence cost and tools you can use to help estimate and manage your cloud spend.

topItems.title: Choose the right Azure services by examining SLAs and service lifecycle
topItems.excerpt: Learn about service-level agreements (SLAs) in Azure, and how they can affect your application design decisions. See how to access preview services and learn how they affect your planning.

value.title: Build the intelligent edge with Azure IoT Edge
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Edge
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Deploy a pre-built module to the Edge device
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
topItems.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

topItems.title: Route system feedback to development teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

value.title: Cloud administration basics
value.excerpt: The first learning path in a course on Cloud Administration from Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the basics of the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types of services, in preparation for real-world cloud practice on Azure.

topItems.title: Foundations of cloud computing for administrators
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the cloud, including the history, building blocks, and types on your way to becoming a Cloud Administrator.

topItems.title: Provision and manage cloud services
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about the different types of resources available on the cloud and the technology behind how they work.

topItems.title: Secure your cloud resources with access control
topItems.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Learn about digital identities and how they can be managed and synchronized within an organization.

value.title: Cloud storage
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Gain a deep understanding of data and how it's stored on the cloud.

topItems.title: Cloud storage overview
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn all about data and get an overview of how it's stored, including local and distributed file systems, databases, and object storage.

topItems.title: Case studies: Distributed file systems
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover how distributed file systems work, then learn about Hadoop and Ceph.

topItems.title: Case studies: NoSQL databases and cloud object storage
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about two more types of storage - NoSQL databases and object storage - with case studies from industry.

value.title: Create conversational AI solutions
value.excerpt: Conversational AI revolves around user interactions, in this case through Bots. In this learning path, you will learn how to create chat bots and integrate the bot with various AI services to add intelligence to the interaction. Learn how to integrate the QnA Maker Service (an easy method to add question and answers for bots), and explore the new Virtual Assistant scenarios for creating branded experiences with bots.

topItems.title: Build a chat bot with the Azure portal
topItems.excerpt: Create and test a basic chat bot using the Azure portal

topItems.title: Design a bot conversation flow
topItems.excerpt: Learn the principles of good bot design and implement conversational flows, knowledge bots, and how to hand-off interactions to a human.

topItems.title: Create a Bot with the Bot Framework Composer
topItems.excerpt: User the Bot Framework Composer to quickly and easily build sophisticated conversational bots without writing code.

value.title: Create Intelligent Bots with the Azure Bot Service
value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how to build a chat bot to interact with customers using text, graphics, or speech with extras from QnA Maker and LUIS.

topItems.title: Build a bot with QnA Maker and Azure Bot Service
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create a bot that answers frequently asked questions.

value.excerpt: Describe the capabilities of Microsoft compliance solutions

topItems.title: Describe the compliance management capabilities in Microsoft
topItems.excerpt: Describe the compliance management capabilities in Microsoft

topItems.title: Describe resource governance capabilities in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Describe resource governance capabilities in Azure

topItems.excerpt: Describe basic security capabilities in Azure

topItems.title: Describe security management capabilities of Azure
topItems.excerpt: Describe security management capabilities of Azure

topItems.excerpt: Describe security capabilities of Azure Sentinel
